title: The Changelog: Software Development, Open Source

items.title: State of the "log" 2024 (Friends)
items.content:
Our 7th annual year-end wrap-up is here! We‚Äôre featuring 12 listener voicemails, dope Breakmaster Cylinder remixes & our favorite episodes of the year. Thanks for listening! üíö

Join the discussion

Push-button deployments that scale to thousands of instances. Check out the speedrun to get started in minutes.

You can try it for free for 30 days - but we‚Äôre confident you will not want to return it (we love ours). Once you experience AI-optimized sleep, you‚Äôll wonder how you ever slept without it. Leverage zero set up dev, test and production environments. Ship faster with an AI code assistant. And work with Wix headless API‚Äôs on any tech stack.
  • Retool ‚Äì The low-code platform for developers to build internal tools ‚Äî Some of the best teams out there trust Retool‚Ä¶Brex, Coinbase, Plaid, Doordash, LegalGenius, Amazon, Allbirds, Peloton, and so many more ‚Äì the developers at these teams trust Retool as the platform to build their internal tools. Try it free at retool.com/changelog

Show Notes:

Many episodes were favorited more than once! We only list the first mention here‚Ä¶

AJ Kerrigan‚Äôs favs:

Don Mackinnon‚Äôs favs:

  • From Chef to System Initiative featuring Adam Jacob (Friends #55)
  • Rails is having a moment (again) with DHH (Interviews #615)

Brett Cannon‚Äôs favs:

  • From Sun to Oxide with Bryan Cantrill (Interviews #592)
  • Free-threaded Python with Pablo & ≈Åukasz (Interviews #611)
  • Gradually gradually typing Elixir featuring Jos√© Valim (Friends #28)
  • Linux distros with Jorge Castro (Ship It! #122)
  • Let‚Äôs talk FreeBSD (finally) with Allan Jude (Interviews #574)

  • Retired, not tired. with Kelsey Hightower (Interviews #595)

Nabeel Sulieman‚Äôs favs:

  • The Moneyball approach with John Nunemaker (Interviews #612)
  • Into the Bobiverse featuring Dennis E. Taylor (Interviews #603)

Rusty Nail‚Äôs favs:

  • Lessons from 10k hours of programming (Remastered) with Matt Rickard (Interviews #613)
  • ‚ÄúFounder Mode‚Äù at work when you‚Äôre not a founder (Go Time #332)
  • The best, worst codebase with Jimmy Miller (Changelog Interviews #609)
  • Bus factors & conspiracy theories (Friends #70)

Jamie Tanna‚Äôs favs:

  • Yeeting stuff into public with Jamie Tanna (Friends #31)
  • OpenAPI & API design with Jamie Tanna (Go Time #328)
  • 1999: A Film Odyssey (Changelog++ üîê) (Friends ++)
  • Hack Club takes to the High Seas featuring Acon (Interviews #620)
  • Gotta give to get back with Danny Thompson @ THAT (Interviews #617)

Jerod‚Äôs favs:

  • We ain‚Äôt afraid of no Ghostty! with Mitchell Hashimoto (Interviews #622)

  • You have how many open tabs?! featuring the hallway track at THAT (Friends #29)

  • The man behind the Sandwich featuring Adam Lisagor (Interviews #601)
  • Starbucks DVD peddlers with Emily Freeman & Justin Garrison (Friends #60)

Adam‚Äôs favs:

  • In the beginning (of generative AI) with Joe Reis (Interviews #576)
  • Shift left, seriously. with Deepak Prabhakara & Schalk Neethling (Interviews #575)

Also mentioned:

  • The Royal Tenenbaums (2001) - IMDb

items.title: We ain't afraid of no Ghostty! (Interview)
items.content:
Mitchell Hashimoto joins the show to discuss Ghostty, the newest terminal in town. Mitchell co-founded HashiCorp, took it all the way to IPO, exited in 2023‚Äîand now he‚Äôs working on a terminal emulator called Ghostty. Ghostty is set to 1.0 this month, so we sat down to talk through all the details.

Join the discussion

items.title: Building the developer cloud (Interview)
items.content:
Kurt Mackey is back for a deep dive into what it takes to build the developer cloud. Kurt joins Adam to discuss the alliance between companies and cloud, something Kurt refers to as the ‚ÄúRebel Alliance,‚Äù cloud complexity vs usability, Fly‚Äôs future with Postgres and why they‚Äôve waited, thoughts on Neon and Supabase (Kurt shares a hot take), and our CDN saga and plan to build a simple CDN on Fly called Pipely (still a Pipedream).

Join the discussion

items.title: A new era for the Changelog Podcast Universe (News)
items.content:
We‚Äôre making some big Changelog changes in 2025, the previously featured Stanford study on ghost engineers doesn‚Äôt live up to the hype, Git ingest is a simple service that turns any GitHub repository into a simple text ingest of its codebase, Simon Willison dishes out some hard-earned wisdom he acquired by working at Lanyrd / Eventbrite & Matheus Lima warns us about six mistakes that new managers make.

items.title: If not React, then what? (News)
items.content:
Alex Russell answers the question, ‚ÄúIf not React, then what?‚Äù Csaba Okrona identifies four core problems that create and reinforce knowledge silos, Rob Koch‚Äôs Markwhen is like Markdown for timelines, Jeff Geerling is quite impressed by Apple‚Äôs latest iteration on the Mac mini & Sylvain Kerkour took the time to draw a comparison of Amazon‚Äôs O.G. S3 service with Cloudflare‚Äôs R2 competitor.

View the newsletter

Join the discussion
